A project manager has been assigned to a project where collaboration with the business is a critical key factor. The project manager is not sure about which approach to use. A senior project manager has been assigned to help the project manager.
What advice should the senior project manager provide?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Voting for A
Ultimately, both Option A and Option B emphasize the importance of collaboration with the business, and the best advice from the senior project manager would consider the project's unique requirements, organizational context, and the expertise of the team members in different project management methodologies. The senior project manager might even combine elements of different approaches to create a hybrid approach that best suits the project's needs and maximizes the potential for successful collaboration with the business.

Collaboration is the keyword here.

A. Work with the project manager to develop a new approach that will bring benefits to the project

This option is out. Why we're talking about developing a new approach and project benefits when question doesn't mention anything about it. Moreover, new approach might take time and we are trying to re-invent the wheel which is already well established in Agile practices.

C. Establish a project management methodology that requires the customer to provide daily updates to the team

This option is out. We have to do the collaboration and not just push the updates to the customer

D. Provide a project management template for the project manager to follow as a guide

This option is out. might be helpful for structure, but it doesn’t directly address the importance of collaboration as a key success factor.

B. Suggest using an agile approach since customer and team collaboration is critical for project success

This is the correct option. Here collaboration is the key word and Agile is all about collaboration

This ensures that all relevant parties are aware of the new risk and can collaboratively work on addressing it.

A. Confirming that the risk register was completed and validated ignores the new information and would not adequately address the risk.
B. Performing a risk analysis directly with the stakeholder is useful, but the project manager should involve the full project team to ensure all perspectives are considered.
C. Communicating the risk to the steering committee and requesting a mitigation plan from senior management bypasses the project team and limits collaborative input.
